gurmukhi: kho eyk eykM AnykM pRkwrM ] imly ju`D jyqy smMqM lu`JwrM ]398]
transliteration: Kaho Ek Ekan Anekan Prakaaran|| Mile Judh Jete Samanndan Lujjhaaran||398||
translation: All those warriors who are fighting in the battlefield, they can be described one by one in various ways.398.
Speech of Vibhishana addressed to Ram :

gurmukhi: DuMnM mMflwkwr jwko ibrwjY ] isrM jYq p`qRM isqM C`qR CwjY ]
transliteration: Dhounan Mandlaakaar Jaako Biraajai|| Siran Jait Pattran Sitan Chhattra Chhaadai||
translation: He, who has the spherical bow and on whose head the white canopy is rotating like a letter of victory;

gurmukhi: rQM ibstqM bXwGR crmM ABIqM ] iqsY nwQ jwno hTI ieMdR jIqM ]399]
transliteration: Rathag Bistatan Byaaghra Charman Abheetan|| Tisai Naath Jaano Hathiindra Jitan||399||
translation: And who is sitting on the lion-skin fearlessly in the chariot, O Lord, he is the persistent Inderjit (Meghand).399.

gurmukhi: nhy ipMg bwjI rQM jyn soBYN ] mhwN kwie pyKy sBY dyv CoBYN ]
transliteration: Nahe Peeng Baajirathan Jen Sobhain|| Mahaan Kaae Pikhe Sabhai Dev Chhodhhain||
translation: He, with whose chariot there are brown horses and seeing whose broad body even the gods become fearful;

gurmukhi: hry srb grbM DnM pwl dyvM ] mhwN kwie nwmw mhwNbIr jyvM ]400]
transliteration: Dare Sarab Gadaban Dhanan Paal Devan|| Mahaan Kaae Naamaa Mahaanbeer Jevan||400||
translation: And who has mashed the pride of all the gods, he is known as broad-bodies Kumbhkaran.400.

gurmukhi: lgy mXUr brxM rQM jyn bwjI ] bkY mwr mwrM qjY bwx rwjI
transliteration: Lage Myoor Baranan Rathan Jen Baajee|| Bakai Maar Maaran Tajai Baan Raajee||
translation: The chariot with which the peacock-coloured horses are harnessed and who is showering arrows alongwith his shouts of “Kill, Kill”,

gurmukhi: mhwN ju`D ko kr mhodr bKwno ] iqsY ju`D krqw bfo rwm jwno ]401]
transliteration: Mahaan Juddh Ko Kar Mahodar Bakhaano|| Tisai Juddh Kartaa Bado Raam Jaano||401||
translation: O Ram ! his name is Mahodar and should be considered a very great warrior.401.

gurmukhi: lgy muKkM brx bwjI rQysM ] hsY paun ky gaun ko cwr dysM ]
transliteration: Lage Moukhkan Haran Baajirathesan|| Hasai Paoun Ke Gaddd Ko Chaar Desan||
translation: The chariot with which the white horses like the face are harnessed, and who, in gait, put the wind to shame;

gurmukhi: Dry bwx pwxM ikDo kwl rUpM ] iqsY rwm jwno shI deIq BUpM ]402]
transliteration: Ddare Baan Paanan Kidho Kaal Roopan|| Tisai Raam Jaano Sahidaeet Bhoopan||402
translation: And who seems like death (KAL), catching hold of his arrows in his hand, O Ram ! consider him as Ravana, the king of demons.402.

gurmukhi: iPrY mor pu`CM FurY caur cwrM ] rVY ik`q bMdI AnMqM ApwrM ]
transliteration: Phirai Mor Pouchchhan Dhurai Chaur Chaaran|| Radai Kitt Bandianaaatan Apaaran||
translation: He, on whom the fly-whisk of the feathers of a peacock is being waved and before whom many people many people are standing in the posture of salutation;

gurmukhi: rQM suvrx kI ikMkxI cwr sohY ] lKy dyv kMinAw mhwN qyj mohY ]403]
transliteration: Rathan Suvaran Kikinkanichaar Sohai|| Lakhe Dev Kanniaa Mahaan Tej Mohair||403||
translation: He whose chariot the small bells of gold seem impressive and seeing whom the daughter of gods are getting enamoured.403.

gurmukhi: CkY m`D jwkI Dujw swrdUlM ] iehY deIq rwjM durM dRoh mUlM ]
transliteration: Chhakai Maddh Jaakidhujaa Saardoolan|| Ihai Daeet Raajan Duran Droh Moondan||
translation: In the centre of whose banner there is the sign of a lion, he is Ravana, the king of demons and has ill-will for Ram in his mind;

gurmukhi: lsY kRIt sIsM ksY cMdR Bw ko ] rmw nwQ cIno dsM gRIv qwko ]404]
transliteration: Lasai Kreet Seesan Kasai Channdra Bhaa Ko|| Ramaa Naath Cheeno Dasan Greev Taako||404||
translation: He on whose crown there are the moon and the sun, O all-filling Lord ! Recognise him, is the ten-headed Ravana.404.
